intro: Cephalophora robusta, commonly known as the robust cephalophora, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant typically features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of tubular flowers in shades of red, orange, and yellow. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
